feed.title: SAP Community - SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud
feed.subtitle: SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: CBC Baseline Scopes vs. Manual Selection – What’s the Best Practice?
entry.content:
Hello Community,

We are currently running an SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (version 2508, Colombia localization) implementation project and have encountered the following situation:

  • During the configuration in Central Business Configuration (CBC), we advanced through the Fit-to-Standard workshops and proceeded to load the Finance scope items.

  • Upon validation, we noticed that some scope items selected in the DDA are no activated (e.g., 1GB, 1GF, 33M, 3M4, BGC) we find out that they were retired or absorbed into other processes.

  • When trying to load the scopes through a JSON file, the full Baseline gets re-activated. This includes scope items that are not needed for our specific business case.

Our questions are:

  1. Is it necessary or mandatory to always work with the full Baseline in implementation projects, even if it contains scope items that do not apply to the customer?

  2. What is the recommended approach in such cases?

    • Proceed with the Baseline including the “extra” scopes?

    • Or manually select only the scope items strictly required for the business?

  3. What is the best practice to avoid inconsistencies in CBC when loading/adjusting scopes via JSON, considering that this automatically re-activates the baseline?

We would greatly appreciate guidance from the community (or SAP directly) on the recommended way forward in these scenarios, as we want to ensure the configuration complies with the standard and avoids rework later on.

Thank you in advance!

entry.title: Baseline scope items activation – how to prevent unwanted items
entry.content:
We are currently activating the required scope items for our project, but several scope items that we have already identified as not to be implemented are also being activated. Some of them, such as 1MC and 2LH, seem to be part of the baseline.

Is it possible to prevent these scope items from being activated, or does the baseline always need to remain fully active?

entry.title: Scope items included in DDA but not available in CBC – Guidance needed (S/4HANA Cloud Public 2508)
entry.content:
Hello Community,

We are currently working on an SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (release 2508, Colombia localization) project and have encountered an issue related to scope items availability:

During our Fit-to-Standard workshops and the Digital Discovery Assessment (DDA), the following scope items were included in our functional package:

  • 1GB – Asset Accounting with Group Ledger (IFRS)

  • 1GF – Assets Under Construction with Group Ledger (IFRS)

  • 33M – Revenue Recognition – Sell from Stock (IFRS)

  • 3M4 – Revenue Recognition – Service Documents (IFRS)

  • BGC – Fiori Analytical Apps for General Ledger

  • 2JB – SAP Fiori Analytical Apps for Financial Accounting

  • 1GI – General Ledger Allocation Cycle

However, when moving forward with the configuration in Central Business Configuration (CBC) and in Signavio Process Navigator, we noticed that these scope items are not available for selection.

This raises uncertainty on how to proceed, and we would like to ask the community for guidance:

  1. Have these scope items been officially retired in release 2508, and are their capabilities already integrated into other scope items (e.g., Universal Parallel Accounting, Universal Allocation, or Fiori analytical catalogs)?

  2. Is there any alternative procedure to enable them in CBC?

  3. If they have been replaced, what are the successor scope items or the best practice recommended to cover these functionalities in the project?

Our main goal is to ensure that the scope defined in DDA is properly reflected in CBC, without leaving functional gaps or including obsolete scope items.

Any guidance from the community (or SAP experts) on the best way forward would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you in advance!

entry.title: API for Creating Product Characteristics on S4HC Public Edition.
entry.content:
Hi Practitioners,

Is there any API available on S4 Hana Public cloud out of the box to create Product Characteristics and assign the values. The Product Master (A2X) API does not have any possible way to create Classification Data for holding the Product Characteristic values.
The API Product Master Data Including Classification – Read does not have Create option and it is limited to Read.
Please suggest any API for creating the characteristic data for a product. 

Regards,
Shyam Prasad

entry.title: How to Add Text IDs for Customer Master (KNA1) in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition?
entry.content:
In SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, I would like to add a new Text ID for the Customer Master (KNA1) via CBC.

However, I can only find the configuration activity “Define Text Types for Sales Area Texts in Customer Master(SSCUI: 105683)” (which is related to KNVV). I cannot find any configuration option to add or maintain Text IDs for KNA1.

Does anyone know if it is possible to add Text IDs for KNA1 in S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, and if so, how this can be done?

entry.title: S4HC Public Cloud Eclipse created CDS and AMDP
entry.content:
Hi 

we have a S/4 HANA PUBLIC CLOUD.  I am trying to understand AMDP.  Have followed this blog Understanding CDS Table Functions | by SATYASRI AKULA | SAP Innovation Hub | Medium and exactly followed the instructions .

In Eclipse the provided CDS Table Function has activated

but the AMDP class on the line FOR TABLE FUNCTION Z_JOURNAL_DATA

has a syntax error The method "GET_JE_DATA" implements the CDS table function "Z_JOURNAL_DATA". The client handling annotation for "Z_JOURNAL_DATA" is incomplete or wrong in the current language version.

I tried to fix it by including the annotations as below but I still get that same error.  Why ?

CDS table function - this activated ok

@EndUserText.label: 'Journal Data'
@AccessControl.authorizationCheck: #NOT_REQUIRED // No auth checks (default)
@ClientHandling.algorithm: #SESSION_VARIABLE //the client_element_name column is filled from the session client (sy-mandt).
@ClientHandling.type: #CLIENT_DEPENDENT //artifact ignores clients (like cross-client customizing tables in ABAP).

define table function Z_JOURNAL_DATA
with parameters @Environment.systemField: #CLIENT
     i_rclnt   : mandt,
     i_RBUKRS  : bukrs, 
     i_GJAHR   : gjahr 
    
returns {
    rclnt :mandt;
    RLDNR : fins_ledger; 
    RBUKRS: bukrs; 
    GJAHR : gjahr; 
    BELNR : belnr_d; 
  
}

implemented by method zcl_acc_je_dat=>GET_JE_DATA;

ADMP Class  - it errors on the FOR TABLE FUNCTION Z_JOURNAL_DATA.

CLASS zcl_acc_je_dat DEFINITION PUBLIC.
PUBLIC SECTION.

TYPES: BEGIN OF ty_je,
        rclnt  TYPE mandt,
        rldnr  TYPE FINS_LEDGER,
        rbukrs TYPE bukrs,
        gjahr  TYPE gjahr,
        belnr  TYPE belnr_d,
        rhcur  TYPE FINS_CURRH,
        END   OF ty_je,
       tt_acc_data TYPE TABLE OF ty_je.

  DATA: lv_where TYPE  string,
        lv_fin   TYPE  tt_acc_data ,
        lt_filter TYPE tt_acc_data.


INTERFACES if_amdp_marker_hdb.
    CLASS-METHODS  GET_JE_DATA 
 FOR TABLE FUNCTION Z_JOURNAL_DATA.

ENDCLASS.

CLASS zcl_acc_je_dat IMPLEMENTATION.
METHOD GET_JE_DATA BY DATABASE FUNCTION FOR HDB LANGUAGE SQLSCRIPT OPTIONS READ-ONLY USING ACDOCA.

       return SELECT rclnt, rldnr, rbukrs, gjahr, belnr, rhcur FROM acdoca
      WHERE rclnt =  :i_rclnt
        AND rbukrs = :i_rbukrs
        AND gjahr =  :i_gjahr;

ENDMETHOD.
ENDCLASS.

entry.title: How to prevent creating planned order when MRP run with inactive BOM
entry.content:
Hi,

We recently encountered a situation. We set an inactive BOM for an item. We had a requirement for this item, and when MRP ran, it created a planned order with empty components. We were able to convert it to a production order, even though there were no components in the order.

How can we ensure that when MRP run, it doesn't create a planned order if the BOM is inactive?


when we create production order with inactive BOM, the system block

Thank you

entry.title: Lot sizing procedure in APP Monitor Material Coverage - Net/individual segments?
entry.content:
Hi,

Lot sizing procedure of product is not available as a filter or column in the APP Material Coverage - Net/individual segments.

Do you know a way to add it?

i tried to adapt UI, but we don't have the choice to add it

Thank you

entry.title: Lot sizing procedure "EX" reaction with sales order in same day
entry.content:
Hi,

we use lot sizing procedure "EX" = Lot-for-lot order quantity for many products

When we have one sale order per day, the system works as expected and creates one planned order per day.

But when we have two sales orders on the same day, the system regroups the requirements into a single planned order.
We expected the system to create two planned orders.

Do you know why, and is there anything we can do to improve our situation and ensure that MRP creates two planned orders if we have two orders on the same day?

 

thank you

entry.title: Group reporting: Unable to Consolidate correctly Equity based method entities- indirect shareholding
entry.content:
Dear community, I have the following Group structure and would like to know why my consolidation is not producing the anticipated results: with Group reporting cloud based version using Rules based Cost of investments.

Group structure : Single Group A where:

Company J184 is the Holding company and  company J0196  and company 197 are both Equity based investments. 

Company J0184 owns 30% in Company J0196. The participation ( cost of investment) of J0184 in J0196 is  52,000

Company J196 owns 40% in company J0197. The Participation( cost of investment) of J0196 in J0197 is 8,000

The Group share of J184 in J0197 is 30% x 40% =12%.

All data that has been imported into the system is data import.png.

Once the consolidation has been run, I see immediately that the Cost of investment of J0196 in J0197 is eliminated twice, once through the PCC process in Document 0Z preparation of Group changes -8000 and also document 3A  investment of Equity elimination -8000.  So the cost of investment 172100 is eliminated twice. 

How should the system be set up so that the cost of investment is not eliminated twice and we have an over elimination which is clearly incorrect.  I also see other issues but I would like to start the discussion here. Looking forward to hearing from an expert on this soon.

kind regards

Colin

entry.title: abapGit plug-in to import the ABAP Flight Reference Scenario fails "Change recording must be activat
entry.content:
@CarineTchoutouo @Andre_Fischer 

Hi guys

I have SAP system S/4 HANA PUBLIC CLOUD.   I have Eclipse installed with the latest software updates as of 11th Sept 2025 eg. ABAP Development tool v3.52

I am encountering an issue when using the abapGit plug-in in ABAP Development Tools (ADT) in Eclipse to import the ABAP Flight Reference Scenario (https://github.com/SAP-samples/abap-platform-refscen-flight.git) into an ABAP Cloud Project in our S/4HANA Cloud public edition system. The import process fails with the error: "Change recording must be activated for package /DMO/FLIGHT_REUSE." Upon investigation, the abapGit Repository import process is unable to create it. I need assistance to resolve this issue and successfully import the SFLIGHT objects (e.g., /DMO/I_Flight, /DMO/I_Travel_U) for use in an AMDP class.

Following this abap-platform-refscen-flight/README.md at ABAP-platform-cloud · SAP-samples/abap-platform-refscen-flight

I have done as instructed but I am getting that error . I have seen SAP note 3630488 - Adt Package Builder: Package creation not possible because of missing Recording Changes Flag - SAP for Me
The package creation wizard was reworked in release SAP BTP 2508, so that it now requires the new ADT client 3.52  - But I am on that version.

entry.title: Business Partner Replication from S/4HANA Public Cloud to EWM fails due to missing General Role
entry.content:
Hello experts,

We are currently facing an issue with Business Partner replication via DRF from S/4HANA Public Cloud to a decentral SAP EWM system.

Scenario

  • In S/4HANA Public Cloud, when we create a Business Partner (with Customer and/or Vendor roles), the General role (000000) is not visible/maintained in the frontend.

  • When replicating this BP via DRF , the message is successfully sent from S/4HANA Cloud.

  • However, in EWM inbound processing , the message fails with an Application Error.

Error Log in EWM

In transaction SRT_MONI, we see the following details:

 

Analysis

  • EWM requires the General BP role (000000) to be present in order to assign and process additional roles (Customer, Vendor, etc.).

  • In S/4HANA Public Cloud, this General role seems to be handled internally, but it is not explicitly replicated via DRF.

  • As a result, the EWM inbound proxy cannot process the payload and throws the application error.

Questions

  1. Is there an official fix or SAP Note that covers this gap (e.g., automatic inclusion of General role during DRF replication)?

  2. If not, do we need to build a custom solution (BAdI / extension in S/4HANA Public Cloud or EWM) to enrich the payload with BP role 000000 before EWM processes it? If yes, is this only possible on the EWM side?

  3. Can confirm whether this scenario is supported out-of-the-box, or if it is out of scope for standard S/4HANA Cloud ↔ EWM integration?

Additional Context

  • The issue is reproducible with any new BP replication.

  • In S/4HANA Cloud, the DRF message monitor shows successful processing, but the EWM side always fails with the error mentioned.

  • We already verified that the inbound service BusinessPartnerSUITEBulkReplicateRequest_In is active and the communication arrangement is correct.

Any insights, SAP Notes, or confirmation from SAP would be highly appreciated.

Thanks in advance,

entry.title: S4 Public Cloud - Embedded Steampunk - Custom Adobe Form from scratch
entry.content:
Hello, 

I'm working on an S4 Public Cloud project using an Embedded Steampunk (RAP) environment. I need to build an app from scratch with a button to print a PDF form.

Therefore, I cannot use any predefined form templates. I must create a custom template and a custom data source, all from scratch, and then be able to use it from my RAP app.

I've reviewed note 3356705 (https://me.sap.com/notes/3356705/E), which states that it's not possible to upload templates with the Maintain Form Templates app because a custom data source cannot be used. Therefore, I would assume it's not possible.

But I also reviewed note 3355397 (https://me.sap.com/notes/3355397/E). This note states that, starting with version 2508, the CL_FP_FORM_READER class exists to work with forms using ADTs (RAP).

The problem is that if I can't upload forms from scratch and data sources from scratch, am I still unable to create and work with custom forms from my custom apps?

The notes are a bit confusing. Does anyone know if this is now possible without using the Adobe Forms BTP service? That is, by creating the custom forms directly in the S4 Public Cloud.

Thanks a lot. 

Kind Regards.
